required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Double-Blind, Randomized, Placebo and Active Comparator Controlled Dose-Range Finding Study of MK0893 in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Who Have Inadequate Glycemic Control

brief_summary.textblock: A study to compare MK0893 to metformin or placebo for patients with Type 2 diabetes (Diabetes Mellitus).

clinical_study.why_stopped: Sufficient data regarding the dose-response to MK-0893 had been obtained from the first cohort of the study to assess the safety and efficacy

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 12 in Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 12 in Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c)
Change From Baseline to Week 12 in 2-Hour Post Prandial Glucose (PPG)

arm_group.description: MK0893 tablets totaling 80 mg once daily.
MK0893 tablets totaling 60 mg once daily.
Metformin HCL 500 mg tablet twice daily BID titrating up to 1000 mg twice daily over 3 weeks.

intervention.description: MK0893 taken orally once daily; 20 mg and 40 mg tablets used in combination according to dose.
Metformin HCL 500 mg tablet twice daily titrating up to 1000 mg twice daily over 3 weeks.
Dose-matched placebo tablets to MK0893; taken orally once daily.
Dose-matched placebo tablets to metformin (500 mg); taken orally twice daily.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who have Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus, with suboptimal glucose control, while either not on AHA (antihyperglycemic agent) therapy or on monotherapy or on low-dose combination therapy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients have a history of Type 1 Diabetes Mellitus
- Patients taking insulin or thiazolidinedione (TZD, a peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor [PPAR]-gamma agonist)
- Patients who have a contraindication to metformin

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to Week 12 in Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG)
outcome.population: All participants who received at least one dose of study therapy, had a baseline measurement, and had at least one post-randomization measurement.

measure.title: Change From Baseline to Week 12 in Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG)
measure.population: All participants who received at least one dose of study therapy, had a baseline measurement, and had at least one post-randomization measurement.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to Week 12 in Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c)
outcome.population: All participants who received at least one dose of study therapy, had a baseline measurement, and had at least one post-randomization measurement.

measure.title: Change From Baseline to Week 12 in Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c)
measure.population: All participants who received at least one dose of study therapy, had a baseline measurement, and had at least one post-randomization measurement.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to Week 12 in 2-Hour Post Prandial Glucose (PPG)
outcome.population: All participants who received at least one dose of study therapy, had a baseline measurement, and had at least one post-randomization measurement.

measure.title: Change From Baseline to Week 12 in 2-Hour Post Prandial Glucose (PPG)
measure.population: All participants who received at least one dose of study therapy, had a baseline measurement, and had at least one post-randomization measurement.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Sufficient data regarding the dose-response to MK-0893 had been obtained from the first cohort of the study to assess the safety and efficacy, thus the study was discontinued.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
